source.raw_text:
The Sandbag Squat Clean is a full-body power movement engaging legs (quads, glutes, hamstrings), back (erectors, lats), core (abs, obliques), and shoulders/arms (delts, biceps) as you explosively pull from the floor and drop under the bag into a front squat, improving functional strength and core stability through complex, multi-joint patterns. It combines hip hinge, pull, and squat patterns for total-body power. [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]  
Muscles Worked 

• Legs: Quadriceps, Glutes, Hamstrings (primary movers for hip/knee extension). 
• Core: Abdominals, Obliques (stabilize torso, maintain upright posture). 
• Back: Erector Spinae (support spine). 
• Shoulders & Arms: Deltoids, Biceps (assist in pulling and catching the bag). [2, 6, 7, 8, 9]  

Movement Patterns & Phases 

1. Setup/Pull (Hip Hinge & Pull): From a deadlift-like stance, you hinge back, then explosively extend hips and knees (triple extension) to lift the bag. 
2. Catch (Scoop & Rack): Quickly flip elbows under the bag, catching it in the "front rack" position on your biceps/shoulders. 
3. Squat (Lowering & Ascent): Drop into a front squat, inhaling as you descend and exhaling as you drive up. 
4. Transition (Cyclical): Often, you immediately initiate the next pull from the bottom of the squat without fully locking out, creating a continuous flow. [4, 6, 10, 11, 12]  

Benefits 

• Develops full-body power and functional strength. 
• Builds core strength and endurance. 
• Improves coordination and athletic movement patterns (hinge, pull, squat). [2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 11, 13]
